column5: I was brushing up on my shooting skills with my compound bow for the deer season. Had to adjust the sites because it was wandering a bit to the right. Got things straightened out but it cost me twenty dollars.    Even pushed the nock straight down the shaft.

very nice. gets expensive if you do it to many times lol. I still have have my first one around somewhere. used to have it on the wall. non shooters wont belive you did it by shooting. i always shoot a 3 spot traget now.
You are now ready for stand 3 grasshopper.  Lets hope it works Monday.
aww . I thought this post was about "bows" as in steelhead
thats one gnarly lookin machine ya got there.i've heard bow hunting is quite an art.has a very high learning curve.
Doug is very good with his bow.Kicks my ass,and I use a crossbow,,,,,,,with a scope.

My god it took me 3 looks to figure out why the arrow was so bloody long. I've done it once with a crossbow using 16" bolts but since have only cut the feathers off. Now can you get a deer broadside and in range?
i would say you are dialed in quite nicely.. Nice shootin ..
Nice shooting Doug I couldn't figure out either why the arrow was so long Twenty dollar shot
